title: Kremlin spokesperson speaks out on Russia's handling of virus
description: In an exclusive interview with CNN, Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov, who tested positive for Covid-19 in May, said "nothing went wrong" in Russia's attempts to contain the virus.

title: Nasdaq tops 10,000 for the first time ever
description: Wall Street's love affair with technology stocks shows no sign of stopping.

title: President of Burundi dies of cardiac arrest
description: Outgoing Burundi President Pierre Nkurunziza died after suffering a heart attack on Monday, according to a statement posted on the official Burundi government Twitter account.

title: Britain's imperialist monuments face a bitter reckoning
Why are UK demonstrators protesting at this statue?
description: Demonstrators gathered at Oxford University in England on Tuesday to seek the removal of the statue of Cecil Rhodes.

title: This city disbanded its police department. Here's what happened next
Trump floats another dangerous conspiracy theory
Series on indigenous activists wins top photography award
description: A powerful series depicting the plight of activists fighting to preserve their communities from mining and agribusiness has led to Uruguayan photographer Pablo Albarenga being named Photographer of the Year at the Sony World Photography Awards 2020.

title: The NFL should re-sign Colin Kaepernick, says Seahawks star
'Miss Hitler' pageant entrant and her partner jailed for belonging to neo-Nazi group
description: A former "Miss Hitler" pageant entrant and her partner have been jailed in the UK for belonging to the extreme right-wing neo-Nazi group National Action.

title: This dangerous fuel spill is a warning of a future that we are unprepared for
description: An approximately 5-million-gallon diesel fuel spill from a power station storage tank near the Arctic town of Norilsk, Russia, poses a deadly threat to the region's people, plants, and animals. Even Russian President Vladimir Putin, who doesn't have a strong environmental track record, has declared a state of emergency.

title: Spectacular drone footage captures thousands of turtles nesting
description: Researchers have captured beautiful aerial footage of thousands of green turtles congregating on the edge of Australia's Great Barrier Reef during the nesting season.

title: Drone footage captures thousands of turtles nesting
description: Researchers have captured beautiful aerial footage of thousands of green turtles on the edge of Australia's Great Barrier Reef during the nesting season.

title: Broadcaster takes down controversial Black Lives Matter anime
description: Japan's public broadcaster has taken down an anime video explaining the "Black Lives Matter" movement after receiving criticism that the video was offensive and failed to explain the complex racial issues accurately.

title: France pledges $17 billion to keep Europe in the aerospace race
World's most expensive cities for expats in 2020 revealed
description: Spot the odd one out in this list of global cities: Hong Kong, Zurich, Singapore and... Ashgabat?

title: Jerry Falwell Jr. apologizes for and deletes blackface tweet
description: Jerry Falwell Jr. is again under fire. This time, however, he is sorry.

title: Daniel Radcliffe responds to J.K. Rowling's tweets about gender identity
description: The boy who lived is speaking out.

title: This city disbanded its police department 7 years ago. Here's what happened next
description: Last week, Minneapolis officials confirmed they were considering a fairly rare course of action: disbanding the city police department.

title: Tesla may have some new competition from a company with a familiar name
description: Elon Musk and Tesla may have some new competition -- in the auto market, on Wall Street and on social media.

title: Trump's deeply irresponsible conspiracy theory on the man, 75, pushed by police
description: The footage is striking.

title: Museum reimagines masterpieces in the pandemic, complete with face masks
description: A UK museum has released reimagined versions of some of its most loved masterpieces, with subjects donning face masks amid the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Russia raises stakes with 'brazen' military intervention in Libyan conflict
description: The voice behind the camera rings with falsetto glee as the frame fills with the remains of an aircraft, its wings burned and skeletal, its jet engine slumped in the wreckage.

title: Keanu Reeves on why he's returning for 'Matrix 4'
description: Keanu Reeves is already offering a sterling review of the planned new "Matrix."

title: Nigerian women protest against rape and sexual violence
description: Protesters have taken to the streets in cities across Nigeria to demand urgent action to combat rape and sexual violence against women.

title: Glass-bottom deck opens atop China's 'horizontal skyscraper'
description: It's easy to see why "The Crystal" is one of the most highly anticipated new attractions in China.

title: Inside 'American Horror Story' creator's LA and NYC homes
description: Writer and director Ryan Murphy was 8 years old when his parents first let him decorate his room. "I decided to buck the bland and go bold: olive-green walls, chocolate-brown shag carpeting -- and a gold disco ball," he recalled in the latest issue of Architectural Digest, as he opened the doors to his quietly luxurious LA and New York homes.

title: Probiotics don't do much for most people's gut health despite the hype, review finds
description: Whether contained in yogurt or stuffed into capsules and sold on pharmacy shelves, probiotics are popular among the health conscious, with millions of people around the world thought to use them.

title: Are new restaurants crazy to be opening right now?
description: On Wednesdays, Palmetto, which opened for the first time on May 11 in Oakland, California, serves a full prime rib dinner -- to go.

title: The illegal industry booming under lockdown in South Africa
description: In South Africa, a coronavirus ban on cigarettes and alcohol has sparked an illegal business. CNN's David McKenzie speaks with soldiers trying to enforce the ban and with a Zimbabwean cigarette smuggler, who says his "profits are up."

title: The border spat between India and China is turning into an all-out media war
description: China and India's latest border dispute may have mainly involved scuffles and troop maneuvers on the ground, but it has been all-out war in the respective countries' media.

title: How the UK became Europe's nation worst affected by Covid-19
description: More than 50,000 people in the United Kingdom have died after contracting Covid-19, according to statistic bodies from all of the nations within the UK. CNN's Nic Robertson reports on how Britain reached this grim milestone.

title: Can the American-led Black Lives Matter movement trigger an African awakening?
description: A good friend of mine shared this story with me. When her daughter was seven, she told her mother in no uncertain terms that she didn't want any black kids at her own birthday party.  My friend was shocked not just because her daughter was black -- so was she -- but because her daughter felt that black people were not the kind of people she wanted at her party.

title: Australia's rare, elusive night parrot may not see that well in the dark
description: Australia's night parrot is nocturnal, but the rare and elusive bird may not actually be able to see very well in the dark, according to a new study.

title: North Korea isn't talking to the South anymore. Experts say it could be trying to manufacture a crisis
description: North Korea has shut off all lines of communication with "enemy" South Korea -- a likely signal that Pyongyang is adopting a more confrontational stance towards Seoul after more than two years of detente and failed peace talks.

title: NASCAR's Bubba Wallace wants to rid race tracks of the confederate flag
description: After wearing an "I Can't Breathe" T-shirt to Sunday's race, NASCAR driver Bubba Wallace said the next step is to rid the racetracks of the confederate flag.

title: Teen cycles 750 miles to take her father home amid lockdown
description: A 15 year-old Indian girl, who cycled 750 miles to take her injured father home, has brought attention to the plight of migrant workers caught in the lockdown. Activists say her story highlights desperate measures migrants are taking under the Covid-19 lockdown in India. CNN's Vedika Sud reports.

title: Minneapolis mayor responds after being booed out of rally
description: Minneapolis Mayor Jacob Frey tells CNN's Chris Cuomo that he hasn't changed his stance after being booed by protesters after expressing that he is not on board for abolishing the city's police department

title: Fox News anchor apologizes after offensive image airs
description: Fox News anchor Bret Baier took a moment during his show to apologize for an image that aired comparing stock market performance after widely publicized cases of violence against black men.

title: US police unions prepare for once-in-a-generation showdown
Bill Barr contradicts President Trump on his move to bunker
description: Attorney General William Barr contradicted President Donald Trump when asked during a Fox News interview why the President was taken to the White House bunker during protests.
